website_summaries.verdict: This cookbook features quick and easy-to-follow recipes from one of the biggest names in vegan cooking.
pros: Recipes are delicious, reliable, and generally supermarket-friendly
Includes recipes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (plus dessert)
Most dishes take 30 minutes or less
cons: Typeface can be hard to read on some pages

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This book is HUGE, and every recipe I've tried is good. LOVE Alphabet Soup, Babushka Borscht, Cheddary Broccoli Soup (this alone might be worth the price of the whole book!), Ancho Lentil Tacos, Lentil-Quinoa Stew, Dilly Stew (yum!), Roasty Soba Bowl, Garlicky Thyme Tempe, Classic Baked Tofu, Scrambled Chickpeas, Puffy Pillow Pancakes, Lemon-Blueberry Loaf, Marbled Banana Bread (the best banana bread ever!), Jumbo Oatmeal Raisin Cookies, Pineapple Upside-Down Cake, Orange Chocolate Chip Bundt Cake, and Chocolate-Zucchini Bundt Cake. These are all excellent, and that's just a start. I have so many more to try. So glad I got this book!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: GIVE ME ALL THE FOOD
customer_reviews.text: If you love Isa's blog Post Punk Kitchen - buy. this. cookbook. I have never had a cookbook where I want to make absolutely everything (yes, I have Veganomicon. Meh.) I want to make EVERYTHING in this book. And everything I have made so far is to die for. And as a mom to two young boys, I don't have time mess around with Veganomicon style meals (let's be for real, there were some intense cooking times with those recipes.) This is everything we love about Isa in one book - home style cooking, quick prep and cooking times, appeals to the laziness in all of us and entertaining to read. Every vegan needs this cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Most tasty recipes in a single cookbook! Mmmmm
customer_reviews.text: I own about 10-15 vegan/plant-based cookbooks and this has become my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE! I was almost amazed that every recipe turned out deeeeeeeeelicious. I love Isa's use of herbs and spices for loads of flavor. The techniques used are easy to follow, and she doesn't use weird, hard-to-find ingredients. The cookbook also has a lot of pictures, which I am so thankful for because I believe no cookbook should be without beautiful photographs to entice you. I am super excited to whip up a few more recipes this weekend!
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Not a single bad recipe!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous book for vegans who are beginners with cooking. We weren't cooking beginners but we had just adopted a vegan diet and this is our go to book. Not only are the recipes easy to make and most are super fast but the food is absolutely delicious! We have never eaten such tasty food. We have probably made 1/4 of the recipes so far and not a single one was bad. I love this book and can't say enough good things about it. Get it and try the Sunflower Mac and the Coconut French Toast. To die for!!
customer_reviews.author: Mochasbuttons

customer_reviews.title: I am finally into real vegitarian cooking
customer_reviews.text: I have attempted to use several vegitarian books over the year, all with poor results. The review on her books raved about her recipes and commentaries throughout her books. This book did not disappoint. Her recipes and not "go buy some tofu ..." These are real recipe, solid and they taste good. It has gotten me into some vegitarian cooking and I am checking out other books with new confidence. Hope this helps you.
customer_reviews.author: DeepBlueTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for newbie vegans
customer_reviews.text: What a spectacular cookbook for a newbie vegan. The best part is the ease and speed of the recipes. But just flipping thru the pages before even trying what sounds like delicious recipes, I was so inspired that I had the aha that I didn't need to replace meat - I needed to completely rethink how to cook! I'm more of an inspired cook vs a follow recipes cook, but I'm so excited by what I see here that I will definitely be sticking close to her recipes. And sending copies to two other newbie vegans I know.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Just going vegan? Get this cookbook first!
customer_reviews.text: Isa created recipes that are hearty and easy to make - you can whip many of them up in 30 minutes or less! And there are no weird ingredients either, most you can find at your local grocery store or Whole Foods. She even includes classics such as spaghetti and meatballs and Mac and cheese that really hit the spot! I make these recipes for my omnivore friends and they've loved what I've cooked so far - they couldn't believe it was vegan! Can't say enough good things about this cookbook! Get it! It's a classic on par with The Joy of Cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I eat mostly vegan/vegetarian these days. I have several vegan cookbooks in my collection. I like to think all my cookbooks have delicious recipes, but this is the cookbook I use the most often since I got it! The recipes are made with easily acquired ingredients and simple processes yet are exciting, amazingly delicious, and make you feel good. And they don't take forever to cook! So far I've made a mac & "cheese," a couple of stir fries, and the puréed split pea and rutabaga soup. YUM. Isa does it!
customer_reviews.author: karrotlover

customer_reviews.title: Isa does it AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: Isa is my favorite vegetarian chef/cookbook author. Her recipes are always delicious and easy to make. This cookbook is no different! My husband and I both work full-time so having recipes that are easy to throw together on a regular weekday makes our lives so much easier. I should also say we are not vegans, but we do eat a mostly plant-based diet at home and Isa's recipes sacrifice nothing the way of flavor or texture, whether you eat meat or not. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca E.

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE, DELICIOUS RECIPES... AND HOLY GUACAMOLE... THE SALADS!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't get over how good this book is. Usually I can find 2-5 recipes in a cookbook that I enjoy, but with Isa Does It, every recipe is DELICIOUS. They are easy to make and use accessible ingredients. An unexpected surprise was how good the salad recipes are. Her dressings and ingredient combinations are uncomplicated and create healthy, filling meals. And who the heck gets excited about salads? YOU WILL after buying this book!!
customer_reviews.author: KN23

customer_reviews.title: One of my absolute favorite cookbooks!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my absolute favorite cookbooks and I haven’t even made that many recipes yet. It’s HUGE, and I love that it’s a hardback. The tofu mushroom stroganoff has become one of my favorite vegan recipes of all time! The queso blanco bowls and lentil-a-roni are fabulous as well. I haven’t made any desserts because a lot of them have a lot of oil and I try to avoid oil besides a tiny bit for sautéing. This book is still completely worth it though because there are just SO MANY great recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Erica S

customer_reviews.title: Vegan perfection
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a go to cookbook? Look no further. Every single recipe I have made from this book has knocked it out of the park. Every recipe has been well tested and is easy to make. The book is also beautifully designed. Fun don’t, high quality paper, and beautiful pictures for nearly every recipe. Some favorites are the Falafel Burgers, Tempeh Meatballs and Spaghetti, Pesto Cauliflower Pasta, Tofu Mushroom Stroganoff, Chana Masala, and the list goes on. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: hbh

customer_reviews.title: Lack of detail...
customer_reviews.text: You but a book like this clearly for people who eat healthfully and probably mindful of animal suffering by.. it really ticks me off that none of these break down the content at all.... being vegan i need to know how much protein and not so many carbs not to mention calories but no.... it's so annoying can't someone figure this out.. that were nerf this information. Some of the dishes seemed like one big carb fest....that is not healthy eating.
customer_reviews.author: FitFan

customer_reviews.title: Simply fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I was a lacto ovo vegetarian for 35 years until recently deciding to become vegan. The vegan cookbooks I had were very dreary and not at all appetizing. After looking at the vegan cookbooks on offer on Amazon, I decided to order two of Isa Chandra Moskowitz's cookbooks. I had never heard of her before. WOW! So amazing - these cookbooks (Vegan With a Vengeance and Isa Does It) are so good. I'm sure I can do this now - with Isa's delicious recipes I won't feel at all like I'm missing anything. Thanks Isa - you rock.
customer_reviews.author: OregonCynthia

customer_reviews.title: Kindle version is a scan of a low quality
customer_reviews.text: The recipes in the book look good but the Kindle version is not what I expected. It seems to be a scan of the print book, making the letters difficult to read. The font is generally small and isn't crisp enough. Also the combination of background and font colors doesn't help here. I don't recommend buying the Kindle version.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Kelemen

customer_reviews.title: This is my new all-time favorite vegan cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is my new all-time favorite vegan cookbook. I have cooked 15-20 recipes so far & every one of them has been a hit with my non-vegan husband & the guests I have cooked for. Most of the recipes are indeed "amazingly easy." Isa's commentary preceding the recipes are fun to read. I love her philosophy about keeping things easy, but mostly I love how good everything has been! My #1 repeat favorite has been "Cheddary Broccoli Soup." Honestly, this takes maybe a 1/2 hour to make & the results are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: CeeDu

customer_reviews.title: YUM
customer_reviews.text: I’m not vegan and I love this book. Cooking is one of my passions and this allowed me to get into a different mindset when I cook. Not everything has to be eaten with meat and not does all protein come from animals! Even my boyfriend loves the recipes I cook from this book!
customer_reviews.author: ccammmm24

customer_reviews.title: A Whole New World
customer_reviews.text: I rarely am moved to write reviews. I’ve been using this cookbook regularly since July. Not a single recipe has been disappointing and sometimes like tonight, after making the curry sweet potato soup, I go, “I am a cooking goddess.” I’m not vegan, and not even vegetarian 100% of the time. I was looking to infuse more vegetarian meals into my routine and as the owner of a very many cookbooks, this is a brilliant one. The recipes are easy and delicious. Even as a vegetarian, I used to wonder what on earth vegans. This is a whole new world and a fantastic way to make healthier, more humane and environmentally conscious meals.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cole

customer_reviews.title: I could eat the everyday Pad Thai literally everyday!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! The everyday pad thai I could eat every day. My husband and I have made 7 recipes from this cookbook and have liked all of them. My only complaint is the amount of oil she calls for in her recipes, other than that I highly recommend this cookbook. Easy to follow recipes with easy to find ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: A must-have cookbook for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I saw this book @ my friends house and immediately ordered it. The recipes are amazing for all foodies. The recipes do a great job of taking the mystery out of cooking vegan if you are looking to go vegan and it's inspiration for anyone looking for some new ideas. You don't have to be vegan or even vegetarian to appreciate the very tasty recipes here. The chickpea scramble and a few of the pasta recipes are now my go-to meals.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Easy and varied yummy recipes
customer_reviews.text: I like the way this book is laid out. Incredibly easy to follow or just page through. The recipes thus far have all been great! None are too complicated. There is a decent amount of curry recipes in here so if you are a fan of curry you will be happy. I am not a fan so I just omit it or substitute, all still tasty!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthy of considering
customer_reviews.text: I love all the pictures and even though I get a lot of my recipes online since I am new to vegan cooking I appreciate this cookbook. . In the past I have enjoyed cooking as a hobby and for feeding my family. I am pretty intuitive and picky about what I want to make. I want food to taste good but I don't want it overly complex. This book has enough recipes I will try and is fun enough to look at it, it was worth the cost to me. Isa seems to have a good reputation and knows what she is doing.
customer_reviews.author: Libbygeo

customer_reviews.title: Great, tasty recipes that will make you want to cook more!
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only eaten a few things from this cookbook, but they have been amazing! The berry scones are supper yummy and the roasted butternut Alfredo. OMG I could eat that every day! I am a meat eater, but definitely trying to eat more veggies! I try to eat vegan several times a week. I am loving this cookbook!! I have a friend that has tried more things & she said she has yet to cook anything bad from this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wier

customer_reviews.title: Great primer to get you started cooking vegan!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 3 recipes so far & have only had the book a week. All were yummy, especially the sweet potato & red curry with rice & purple kale. She also has you tube videos for several recipes. I'm working on making the majority of our meals plant based & this book really helps. If you are coming over from the "eat meat with every meal" (I did), don't be afraid to try the "interesting" combinations - I have been pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Mc

customer_reviews.title: Alpha-Gal+ Friendly Cookbook for Non-Vegan, Vegetarian, Etc.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a vegan, but due to alpha-gal allergies (from a tick bite), many things I cook or eat are vegan because I get sick of fish and chicken as my only protein. I am working my way into using tofu, and there are plenty of good recipes in this book that I will be trying. Isa makes vegan look easy! I usually don’t have every ingredient I need for the recipes, but I substitute or leave them out and the dish is still really tasty. So far, I’ve enjoyed every recipe I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang Sally

customer_reviews.title: ... I refuse to admit it) and this is the best one. We've made carrot cake pancakes
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered close to 30 vegan cookbooks (exactly 30 but I refuse to admit it) and this is the best one. We've made carrot cake pancakes, banana muffins, clam chowder, mac and cheese etc. This is by far the one I reach for the most. My 11 year old love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepinbeauty131

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - Even for non vegans!
customer_reviews.text: This book changed how we eat and cook at home. While I'm not a vegan, I eat vegan/vegetarian 95% of the time. As the primary cook in the home, I've enjoy cooking and eating the recipes out of Isa's book. They are all packed with flavor and haven't missed meat at all since buying her book. We have tried probably 30+ recipes in here and would make them all again except for just one of them. Thanks for changing the way we eat!
customer_reviews.author: BDoubleU

customer_reviews.title: I became Vegan because of this cookbook.
customer_reviews.text: Great book! Filling easy recipes. I've convinced non beet eating friends to try the beet burgers and they loved them. I also amazed people with the Vegan nachos who asked over and over- "are you sure there is no meat or cheese in this?" This book isn't full of tofu, seitan or fake food products. I love the food and my kids and husband and everyone else does too. Fun commentary too. Her other book " Vegan with a Vengance" has some great recipes too- especially the unbelievable Punk Rock Gravy. You can make a lot of these reviews and freeze them too.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Love Love this Vegan Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best book with the best vegan recipes I've ever had. I love the cheddary broccoli soup, Island black bean burgers, and a great chili... So many recipes.. If you are a foodie, like to try new things this could be just what you want. I happened to see Isa, who was from Brooklyn and now a midwest transplant, cook on a show called Victory Gardens edibleFeast. Really fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lee

customer_reviews.title: ISA IS THE BOMB!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had the honor of going to Modern Love (Isa's restaurant in Omaha and New York) when living in Omaha litterally weekly. It is so great to know she is out there changing vegan lifestyles and non vegan lifestyles, introducing people to a clean, healthy but amazingly delicious way of cooking and food. Seriously best restaurant i've ever been to! Keep it up Isa!
customer_reviews.author: Troy Graham

customer_reviews.title: The recipes I've really enjoyed are Coconut Chana Saag
customer_reviews.text: I have most of Isa's books and this is one of my favorites. The recipes I've really enjoyed are Coconut Chana Saag, Chana Masala, Pad Thai, Chandra Malai Kofta (even just the sauce is delicious over rice), Blueberry Maple Bran Muffins, Lemon Blueberry Loaf (excellent), Snickerdoodles (perfect), Nora's Lemon Lemon Cookies (perfect), and Almondine Cookies (again, perfect). The recipes are easy to follow and the layout of the book and the graphics are nice.
customer_reviews.author: trimom

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love just about every recipe in this book
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love just about every recipe in this book. It is my go to cookbook. Don't be hesitant to cook vegan because of unfamiliar ingredients. Trust Isa! Once your pantry is stocked you realize that cooking great vegan dishes with great flavors isn't as intimidating as at first glance.
customer_reviews.author: tehernan

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know vegan food could taste so good!
customer_reviews.text: I have one problem with this book.... I saw a recipe for mushroom srtoganoff and since that was one of my favorite foods before going vegan I had to try it. Yesterday I made it for the 4th time, and I doubled the recipe so I'll have more left overs. I haven't tried any other recipe because I'm obsessed with that one! hehe
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Isa Does It Again
customer_reviews.text: Isa does it again. My friends and I decided to challenge ourselves to eat vegan for a month. I started to panic on day three. My friend introduced me to Isa and we have been friends ever since. Her recipes are easy to follow and even easier to eat. On a different note. My book came damaged in that the cover was torn. I emailed Amazon and they promptly credited my account. They were very apologetic and sincere.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie

customer_reviews.title: too much use of oil
customer_reviews.text: i love the introduction but the recipes seemed complicated and I am trying not to use sugar, oil and salt i still prefer china study cookbook and forks over knives cookbook
customer_reviews.author: The Ton

customer_reviews.title: Best Vegan Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write reviews, but we have been cooking with this cookbook and writing in our own comments since 2014. It is BAR NONE our favorite vegan cookbook, and we own about 9 vegan cookbooks. If you’re getting into vegan start with this book! Reasons why we love it: easy to find ingredients, pictures, easy recipes, recipes for many occasions
customer_reviews.author: Tall Guy

customer_reviews.title: Yes, She did it!  Again.
customer_reviews.text: We are not only blessed with Isa's cookbook, but we live near Omaha and have the pleasure of dinning at her incredible restaurant Modern Love. Isa is a talent for which I'm thankful to have discovered! Before Isa's cookbooks, my plate was 3/4 meat 1/4 vegetables. Now it rarely includes meat and my taste buds and stomach are (more) satisfied. This cookbook is fun, witty, and hip. Most importantly, the recipes are easy and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: BAK

customer_reviews.title: Favorite one of all so far has been the vegetable ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only cooked a handful of recipes from this so far, but those have already become staple meals in my house (kimchi portobello mushroom burger, dragon noodle salad, burrito bowl, etc). We are vegetarians but even my husband doesn't feel the need to add cheese to these recipes. Favorite one of all so far has been the vegetable korma...to die for. It's amazing what you can do with cashews! Isa makes everything so fun and easy to understand - a pleasure to flip through, read, and cook from!
customer_reviews.author: E. Handziuk

customer_reviews.title: Recipes format kind of a pain
customer_reviews.text: OK. recipes may be vegan but not really very healthy IMO so I guess you just pick your poison.. Print hart to read. Recipes OK- not really remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Pines

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I’m a terrible vegan cook?
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Wish there were pictures for each step of the way, instead of the final product. I also with there was more explanation on things. Like why do you add carrots to Mac and cheese. Plus most of the ingredients I had to get from a Whole Foods like store. Which isn’t very realistic (I’m sorry i can’t afford to cook like Isa. Baking section is the best, the rest... well I just assume vegan cooking is a whole other world. I have yet to perfect anything from this cook book.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: I love it! The recipes are relatively quick and easy ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a vegan but I wanted to cut down on my dairy products so I thought I'd give this book a try. I love it! The recipes are relatively quick and easy and most importantly taste excellent! My husband (who loves meat) enjoys the meals too, in fact his favorite so far is the spaghetti and meatball recipe. I love that I can enjoy creamy and cheesy meals again without having to feel guilty about the cholesterol! I love the mac and cheese and cheddary broccoli soup recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I am really loving this cookbook. SO Many Unique, delicious recipes. I am so glad I decided to add this cookbook to my ever growing collection. I like the authors style of writing and her use of easy to find ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: homeschool mom to 6

customer_reviews.title: " but these recipes are easy to follow and delicious
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook has changed my life! I have never been able to "cook," but these recipes are easy to follow and delicious. I prepare so much more food at home now and I'm happy with the results. This and her vegan holiday cookbook are my go-to's now. There are a lot of recipes in here so you will not get bored!
customer_reviews.author: Claydotdog

customer_reviews.title: Great Vegan cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew shared this cookbook with me. He and his wife made the chickpeas scramble...Yum! And the whole wheat pancakes!! Decided we needed to be more open to some vegan cooking...not that we'll give up meat, but we're going to start adding more vegan meals to our diet and see what we've been missed!! Isa has done a great job with this cookbook...breaking down the essentials in terms of what you need to keep around, prep time, planning and being an efficient cook. Great job, Isa!
customer_reviews.author: stretch

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not often inclined to write a product review, but I am so impressed with this cookbook I had to share! Every recipe we’ve tried so far has turned out delicious. The instructions are clear, and the resulting flavors are divine. Baked goods, soups, noodle dishes all turned out great. It’s a pretty big cookbook, with tons of variety. Can’t wait to work my way through all these recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Pepper S.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!THANK YOU ISA!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing!!! I just got it today, and I went and got everything I needed so that I could do one of the cookie recipes found in the book. And, let me tell you, the cookies came out incredible! You would never believe you're eating a vegan cookie. I've bought many cookbooks in the past, but many ended up in my shelf because they were too complicated or the instructions weren't very clear. This book is not like that; if you follow the instructions, you will get amazing results. Love it!! I am truly excited and can't wait to do more recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Enogirl4u

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant! Brilliant! Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Is also really does an incredible job making vegan food not only good, it wondrous. I had a hard time letting go of red meat, but the flavors in this cookbook far surpass most vegan recipes I have come across... I miss meat a lot less now.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely the best cookbook--buy it now
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best cookbook--buy it now! Every recipe is delicious and I have favorites that I've made again and again (vegan sloppy joes! vegan pot pie! dilly stew with rosemary dumplings!). This book will change your vegan cooking life!
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: I've been wanting this book for a while
customer_reviews.text: I first came across this book at work, where I got to flip through for a precious few seconds. However, I've been following Isa for years through her blog, Post Punk Kitchen. I was delighted to find a cookbook from her that I could afford: I want Veganomicon, but it'll have to wait for a special occasion. So far we've made two recipes, with the third coming up as soon as we can sprout some mung beans, and we've loves them both. Thank you Isa, for your ferocious dedication to sharing such amazing vegan-ness with the world!
customer_reviews.author: Magna

customer_reviews.title: Plant-based paradise
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty picky about cookbooks, but this one has won me over. I've made five or six recipes so far, and every one has been a winner. My only criticism is the lack of nutritional info on the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: DogMaTX

customer_reviews.title: Fun, easy, delicious recipes
customer_reviews.text: My 20 yr old son likes this cookbook for his new vegan lifestyle which I don't understand at all but I'm learning a lot from this cookbook! Simple recipes that are super delicious! Easy to make meals, normal vegan type ingredients. Very good cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing recipes
customer_reviews.text: Book was recommended by a vegan friend. I am not vegan at all and these recipes are incredible. The family is enjoying our "vegetarian/vegan" days of the week. Great book for those starting the vegan lifestyle since recipes are not complicated but not dump like other books I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Rosebuds007

customer_reviews.title: Life enhancing, thank you, Isa!
customer_reviews.text: This book is beautiful to look at, fun to read and the recipes inside are delicious and easy. So many one pot dishes, everything I'd've made so far has been incredible and accessible. I have now made dumplings and they were fab in the Dilly Stew, the Everyday Pad Thai was easy and sooooo tasty. The Down Home curry is going to be on my regular meal plans. The Sunny Mac is beloved by my child. Thank you Isa, you really excelled yourself and I'm going to be buying this book as gifts for people in the future, f'sure.
customer_reviews.author: Big Barda

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for new vegans
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cookbook! Everything we tried was yummy. Instructions are easy to follow. This is a great vegan starter book. My carnivore husband hasn't even missed the meat. In fact he liked the switch stir fry better than meat. Than you for a great book!
customer_reviews.author: Mt mama

customer_reviews.title: Love the book, good recipes and most are easy
customer_reviews.text: She has some good recipes in here. We’re new to being vegan so we haven’t done the cashew recipes yet and it seems like much of the recipes require raw cashews. They’re expensive where we live right now so I’m ordering them on Amazon to give it a try. Kids didn’t like the pancakes so I just make my usual recipe with egg replacer and non-dairy milk.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: thank you for making my quality of life better. Frankly
customer_reviews.text: Isa, thank you for making my quality of life better. Frankly, a few years ago I used to be afraid of cooking, and when I bought Veganomicon, I became even more intimidated. Maybe made five meals from that book in total. But this book is superb - easy meals that taste good!!! The only thing I still wish to see, is a gluten-free book by Isa, and if she made a grain-free one - it would be paradise. Isa Does Its has way too many seitan recipes. I do hope that I can substitute tempeh or tofu in some without compromising taste and texture too much.
customer_reviews.author: ne

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: No kidding, I am in love with this cookbook. I received it two months ago for Christmas, and I think I've made at least 15 recipes already (which might be a world record for me). Each one has been a hit! And fairly quick and easy to execute. We are vegetarians who also eat fish, but it's really nice sometimes to have an amazing meal that's animal-product free. Some of my faves: the Korean BBQ portabella burger is not to be missed. Also, the New England clam chowder - totally vegan and delish! The harrira, sausage and mushroom stew ... I could keep going, but I won't. This is an amazing cookbook. Don't miss it!
customer_reviews.author: Alison F.

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for quick and delicious vegan recipes, buy this book!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love love love this cookbook! I’ve made a few things so far -easy to read, Ive had most of the ingredients in my pantry and quick preparation. My favorite recipes so far are the baked garlic curry fries and Chicky ‘tuna’ salad..so very delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Sonnet Chase

customer_reviews.title: ... far all of the recipes I've tried have been amazing. The pillow pancakes are delicious
customer_reviews.text: So far all of the recipes I've tried have been amazing. The pillow pancakes are delicious, the ancho- lentil tacos were wonderful, but so far my favorite are the banana-berry scones, I used blueberries instead of raspberries and it still came out delicious.
customer_reviews.author: kade

customer_reviews.title: Top Five Best Cookbooks Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This book just made it to my top five favorite cookbooks! This book is amazing! So many recipes and they are all super creative. I've only made five recipes so far because I just received the book, but I can not wait to make more. The layout is perfect and there are so many pictures throughout. The beginning of the book is great for new cooks or new to vegan maybe. I've been vegan for many years but these recipes seem new and fresh to me. She has several old classics, but Isa puts her own twist on things. Excellent book, I can't say enough about it. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W. Burns

customer_reviews.title: A must have cookbook for every kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Isa Cookbook. I was not disappointed. She delivered another stellar cookbook with lots of great recipes for all level cooks. This is a must for every Vegan kitchen. She does use coconut oil in her baked items, so if you’re oil free you’ll need to substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Gift for a Vegan Newbie
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift to a graduating college senior who is setting up her own vegan kitchen, it was well received by my friend and her mother who is not vegan, but wants to learn the healthy way of eating
customer_reviews.author: MWG

customer_reviews.title: Great vegan cookbook! Buy it !
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best vegan cookbook. Meals are easy 30 minutes and delicious. I never really started cooking till my partner and I bought this book and as Isa describes once you get all the basics in your pantry everything else is pretty easy and it is. Follow her advice on spices and utensils to invest in and the rest falls into place! Thank you for keeping us vegan!
customer_reviews.author: Eric C Bushman

customer_reviews.title: Interesting recipes for foodies
customer_reviews.text: Even non-vegans will love these recipes! It's a foodie's dream book and I am a pescatarian transitioning to mostly vegan. I love the interesting combinations of ingredients and ideas of things I would not have thought to try. Beautifully written and nice photos and illustrations. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Serene

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have made so many recipes and I am a beginner cook too. All recipes have been delicious. If you are just beginning veganism then this cookbook is a great way to start.
customer_reviews.author: Granola chick

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a must have for vegans!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first cookbook after I went fully vegan and the recipes are so delicious and easy! Even my carnivore husband loves the recipes I make from this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful book! And delicious! We made 3 soups: cheezy broccoli, potato-leek and New England Clam chowder (which we named Happy as a clam-chowder) and there were a hit! 84-year old vegan Father in law in NYC has the book to and tells us it’s a great book and he has made many recipes already!
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the wait!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had heard of Isa at the end of last year and ordered Isa Does It in February, only to find that it was out of stock and shipping was delayed. I just received it last week and it was completely worth the wait. The layout of the book is easy to understand, and the book itself is well designed with a ton of recipes and wonderful accompanying pictures. I'm working my way through several of her fantastic recipes in "Appetite for Reduction" and have red flagged at least a dozen recipes from this book as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reine des Coeurs

customer_reviews.title: Best Funny Vegan Foodie Book Around
customer_reviews.text: A Cookbook that will make you laugh out loud. Reading it honestly feels like I’m hanging out with a friend who has a ton of food knowledge and a trick or two up her sleeve. And her tempeh meatballs are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: J. Anaya

customer_reviews.title: Vegan meals elevated
customer_reviews.text: Isa's meals are spot on. We've been using this book for years... and purchased this as a gift for friends who are wanting to eat more plant based. I've made a bunch of recipes ranging from salads, soups, curries, bowls, pastas and even a few baked items modified to be gluten free. Everything has been delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Brian & Caresse

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite cookbook and I’m not even a vegan! I’m slowly converting to a vegan lifestyle and this cookbook has made it so easy. The recipes are fast, easy and delicious. And most important for me, I don’t miss meat or dairy when I eat the meals from this book. I liked it so much I bought a copy for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Brezina

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Every recipe we have tried is delicious. The non-vegetarians in the house even like the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer Mom

customer_reviews.title: Isa Does It!
customer_reviews.text: I eat mostly vegetarian or vegan. I cheat occasionally and eat fish (no meat........it feels like a lead weight in my stomach). I've read many and used many of the recipes in this cookbook, and they are relatively easy and flavorful. I have other vegan cookbooks and Isa's wins first place. Since I'm a dad and husband who does all the cooking, I find vegan the most interesting since it requires ingenuity and creativity. Cooking hamburgers on the grill requires no skills. Isa does come up with recipes that satisfies my vegetarian daughter and my carnivore wife. Great addition to my cookbook library.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite vegan cookbook besides Thug Kitchen; her recipes are delicious! I also love high quality, large photos in cookbooks to entice you to make the recipe and there are lots in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this book
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook helped me enormously in my transition to vegan cooking, and it has significantly raised the both the quality and flavor of my home-cooked meals. The recipes are delicious and filling, the directions are clear, and the advice about how to keep you kitchen stocked is invaluable. Whether you are already a committed vegan or just want to learn a few new recipes, I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Editpro45

customer_reviews.title: Isa is a great cook/chef. She has done a great job with ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this book 5 stars because it deserves it!! Isa is a great cook/chef. She has done a great job with this book. I made clients the pesto soup with gnocchi and they LOVED it! Also made them the black bean burger recipe, and the husband was floored!. I had checked it out at the library before purchasing so I could test the recipes myself, and making the purchase was the smartest thing I did! Can't wait for her next book!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome vegan book
customer_reviews.text: Great, colorful photos and an array of recipes to try. This book is very thick but sturdy. Isa has such a fun personality. It shines through in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Best plant based cookbook ever!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible cookbook! This book taught me how to cook, vegan or otherwise. Easy to follow and fairly simple ingredients. I've been vegan for 4 years now and this was my first and still favorite vegan cookbook. I highly recommend it for "baby vegans" just starting out, and those looking for healthy, flavorful plant based meals that fill you up! Thank you Isa !! <3
customer_reviews.author: lillian

customer_reviews.title: Isa's Absolute Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: I have collected all of her cookbooks over the years and this one is the very best. It's really well edited, the recipes are great and the layout and photos are a compliment to the whole book. It's easy to follow, the ingredients I find are generally normal, everyday things I can get in any grocery store. If you can afford only one vegan cookbook, this is the one. I've had this book for about a year or so and it's been used over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Refined
customer_reviews.text: It's excellent but I donated it to inspire others. I was ready for a more rough-and-ready, throw-it-together vegan cook book, and this one is chef-y and refined. So, it depends on what you're looking for. Her Vegan with a Vengeance book contains some fierce recipies that are go-wild delicious, so I think these would be amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Sage R.

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite cookbook. Recipes are easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite cookbook. Recipes are easy to follow, ingredients are fairly normal, and results are fantastic. Its an everyday winner.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Foresta

customer_reviews.title: Great Food and Style
customer_reviews.text: I have two of Isa Chandra Moskowitz's cookbooks and they are both excellent! I can't think of a single recipe I've tried that I didn't like. Both her books are probably my most go-to cookbooks. Keep up the great work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Isa Does It: Vegan cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive and easy to understand and use. I like it!! Vegan food is not easy to adapt to at first, but this book does explain how to make vegan foods with easy to find ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Tina the S.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Isa's recipes are easy to follow and always a hit
customer_reviews.text: Isa Does It and The Oh She Glows Cookbook are my go-to vegan cookbooks. Isa's recipes are easy to follow and always a hit. My husband requests her cornbread muffins at least once a week. The "Spinach & Black Bean Burrito Bowl with Pepe's Secret Guacamole" and Jerk Sloppy Joes with Coconut Creamed Spinach" are two favorites. We love the "Ranch Salad with Red Potatoes & Smoky Chickpeas" and "Kale Salad with Butternut Squash & Lentils" as well.
customer_reviews.author: Missa

customer_reviews.title: No hard recipes
customer_reviews.text: Best vegan cookbook, everything taste great and ingredients are common at any grocery store! I cook out of it at least 2x a week!!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Recipes for the Vegan Beginner Cook
customer_reviews.text: I have made several recipes out of this cookbook. My family enjoyed them. In one recipe that called for seitan, I had trouble properly preparing it even though I followed the recipe. I wish Isa had explained more about the various types (blocks, cubes, strips, etc) of seitan one can buy. Otherwise the recipes have been easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Kaghan

customer_reviews.title: What a beautiful cookbook! It is certainly in the aspirational category ...
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful cookbook! It is certainly in the aspirational category for me, as the recipes take some preplanning and commitment. I wish Isa would come make them at our house!
customer_reviews.author: Max Barry

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes for vegans and non-vegans!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cookbook that I've bought in a while and I'm not even vegan! Every recipe I have tried has been tasty and enjoyed by my whole family. The recipes aren't too complicated, but are rich in flavor. I like that it is written with a bit of humor too. The pictures are wonderful and make such a difference when you're looking for inspiration. I've also tried her Veganomicon which I also like, but maybe not as much as this one. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: JACSL

customer_reviews.title: great book, incredibly well structured with ingredients that aren't ...
customer_reviews.text: wow! great book, incredibly well structured with ingredients that aren't totally weird, and techniques that aren't at all complicated. Real food for real people in real kitchens - i.e. those of us that like to do something other than spend the day in a kitchen.....every recipe so far has been a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite cookbooks!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun vegan cookbook. So many great recipes! We love the Dilly Stew! Great tips for cooking vegan.
customer_reviews.author: aikrussow

customer_reviews.title: Great detailed Vegan Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This was. part of a Christmas Gift for one of my granddaughters. She was very delighted with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bernardette

customer_reviews.title: I've left out some ingredients that are not so good for me and the dishes are still tasty
customer_reviews.text: The directions are clear, the results are yummy, ingredients common and not some 'where the heck do I get that!' items. I've left out some ingredients that are not so good for me and the dishes are still tasty. At least to me. Short cooking times. Number of servings is listed, cooking time and active cooking time. Really like the notes and extra bits of information. She also includes variations which I like; same basic dish but a little of this or that changes it. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jinnman

customer_reviews.title: 3 words "puffy pillow pancakes"
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite vegan cookbook of all time and I have a TON. I use this book at least once a week and we have the famous "puffy pillow pancakes" every weekend. They are hands down the best pancakes I've ever had. This book has a place in every vegan's kitchen! Haven't found a bad recipe yet!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! The recipes I have made so far were excellent. I love the style and familiarity with which it is written. I liked it so much, I ordered one for my friend who isn't even vegan. I knew she would like the photos and descriptions of things like "weirdo ingredients". Really nice book.
customer_reviews.author: M. P. A.

customer_reviews.title: Isa does it again!
customer_reviews.text: While basic vegan cooking is not tough, you can really be a star if you learn some of the techniques explained in this book. Although I am a long-time vegan, the section on "vegan butchery", in addition to having an amusing name, was helpful instruction in using "vegan proteins", so they may be incorporated into meals. I'd have bought the book for those pages alone. I do have one beef, if you excuse the expression: The pages and images are beautiful, but I'd trade the artwork for bigger, more legible print, particularly in the recipe pages.
customer_reviews.author: Just ask me!

customer_reviews.title: This is my first vegan cookbook and I absolutely love it! I love how the recipes are simple ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first vegan cookbook and I absolutely love it! I love how the recipes are simple to follow and they do not contain any weird, hard to find ingredients. So for everything I have tried was wonderful. I am so glad that I purchased this book and have recommended it to several friends (who are not even vegan).
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes
customer_reviews.text: My second cookbook by Isa! I’ve tried so many recipes so far and have loved all of them. My one year old is a big fan of the waffles and pancakes! Easy toFollow recipes and worth any amount of time you spend cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Noles

customer_reviews.title: Great Start for my Veganism
customer_reviews.text: I like to cook, but I never made tofu as an egg alternative or had any idea what tempeh was. This book really helped my family transition into veganism. Of course, I added my own touch to a lot of the recipes, but it's a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Jason and Anysa

customer_reviews.title: This book is amazing! The recipes are simple and taste amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am interested in the vegan diet because I do not get enough vegetables and fruits into my diet. This book is amazing! The recipes are simple and taste amazing. I am so happy with this cookbook, out of all the cook books I've ever bought this one is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: From Stews to Sweets You Won't Go Wrong Cooking with Isa
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vegan cookbook I have ever used. There are wonderful recipes here and ones I've made over and over include the raspberry scones, a veggie dumpling stew and a perfect tofu scramble. My copy at this point is actually getting a bit tattered I've used it so much. I use it for a lot of my baking, for treats that are a little less calorie dense and also have more of a nutritional bang for the buck. You won't regret ordering this book.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Challis

product_meta.title: Isa Does It: Amazingly Easy, Wildly Delicious Vegan Recipes for Every Day of the Week
